												The tactics involved in playing this game are layered endlessly. If NF has reason to believe you might be heading for straight for railgun heavies, you should respond with a light tank or APC rush early game (unless they are expecting you to, of course). Commanding actual players is extremely challenging but endlessly rewarding. Much like Age of Empires II, the gameplay does not reach any sort of nash-equilibria because the real bottleneck is your own ability to keep track of everything at once.For the soldiers on the ground, the game is totally different. The tactical challenge lies is choosing your class, or the loadout of your tank, and in making sure that the decisions of the team as a whole make sense, and that nobody is missing some sneaky enemy tactic. The constant challenge otherwise is of course, to aim and respond, using cover to keep yourself alive while gaining ground on the enemy. All of the guns respond decently, but you'll find your preferences - I love the sniper and pistol, but many prefer the shotguns. Fortunately none of them are so overpowered that they become the only choice.Unfortunately, although there are many players, most of the time none of them are playing at all. That's why you will see many people arguing over whether the game is "dead" or not. See for yourself with the steam charts tracker[steamcharts.com], which tells you not only if people are playing right now, but also all the trends (saturday and sunday mostly, with a smaller peak on wednesday).http://steamcharts.com/app/17740

												This game. Oh, this game! tl;dr: It's very good and relatively bug-free game/mod on the Source engine. Definitely recommended, especially since it's free. Also a good community if a bit small.Gameplay: 8/10Positives--Cohesive combat system-Immersive/Extensive modifications for vehicles-Multiple weapons to choose from with four different classes-Each class is pretty self explanatory and easy to recognize, yet has uniqueness-Each weapon is fairly well balancedNegatives--Combat can feel somewhat clunky at times-Melee rarely is useful-Buildable MG turrets next to useless at longer ranges and in small spaces equally (Probably balanced still, just throwing it out there)Graphics: 6/10Positives--Often things are easy to identify from the natural landscape-Visuals don't ususally detract from actual gameplayNegatives--Graphics are basic/low quality(It's Source Engine, what do you expect, Triple A graphics?)Content Overview:The description is truthful, it combines strategy with FPS. If you don't mind a few players in the commander and in general who tend to treat the game a bit too much like ARMA, this game is right for you.The commander vehicle is the key to every game. You lose it, game over, other team wins. End of your sad, sad story of hardship. It lets you build things like refineries and barracks. It has some armour, so don't worry about it spontaneously combusting. As long as you don't go into the water like a dumbass, you should be fine.Which brings us to the next sub-topic: Buildings.A variety of buildings exist, including...Refinery: Produces resources for your team to use. Your entire infrastructure depends on at least one of these existing. Don't lose it. Can only be build on corresponding resource nodes.Barracks: Lets your team spawn and change class there. Very important.Armoury: Lets your team regain health, ammo, and allows them to change class.Vehicle Factory: Self explanatory. Allows your team to construct vehicles. More on that later. If you don't have one of these soon, you're probably gonna lose.Repair Station: Repairs and resupplies friendly vehicles.Radar: Allows your team's commander to research new technologies that advance your team's vehicles, or some other things. Also reveals enemies within its range. If you lose this, it either means:A: Your comm is♥♥♥♥♥♥and doesn't know where to place buildingsB: An enemy managed to slip past your defenses and destroyed itC: You're losing. Welcome to life, folks.ML Turret: Stands for Missile Launcher. Can also be built by the engineer class. Only attacks vehicles and buildings.MG Turret: Stands for Machine Gun. Can also be built by the engineer class. Only attacks infantry.Walls: Self explanatory. Can also be built by the engineer class.Engineer exclusive buildings:Camera: Reveals enemies in its line of sightRadar: Reveals enemy vehicles in a certain rangeWith all that, onto the next can of worms, vehicles. I'm not going to go into detail with these. If you want detail, there are plenty of guides on the community page.Light Tank: Also known as the AFV in the Brenodi Empire.Medium Tank: Also known as the Tank in the Brenodi Empire. A (debatedly) more powerful version of the light tank.Heavy Tank: Most powerful (debatedly) tank in either team's arsenal. Can equip (yes) nuclear rockets.Artillery Tank: Fires extremely powerful artillery shells over long distances. If you're not careful, a few of these can completely anihillate a base.APC: Equips machine guns and grenade launchers. Can also act as a spawn point.Jeep: An unarmoured, but fast vehicle with no weapons.I'm not going to go into any more detail then that, but I'd definitely recommend this expansive and unique mod on the Source engine. Development is slow due to lack of funds, but if you like it enough, I'm sure you can help remedy that.With that said, good day.

												tl:dr -> Excellent game for FPS and RTS fans; huge amounts of teamwork and customisation; playing with friends makes it even better. And it's free, so what have you got to lose? Give it a try!Personally, i love this game. The gameplay is unique amongst the FPS and RTS genres; nothing quite like it... And nothing has surpassed it in all these years... Yes it's old, yes the community is small... But the game has something about it... Something that makes people keep coming back to it over all these years. That's why i'm nominating it for the Test of Time award.The teamplay element is amazing, it's great to play alone (so much to explore), but even better with friends. Up to 5 of you can form a squad, and earn bonus points for working together...The game has a lot of depth, huge amounts of customisation available; it's not cosmetics though, but real meaningful options that improve and change how your character plays and the vehicles you can build over the course of a game...And it has Vehicles too... and now the RTS elements come into play here... you can research new technologies that allow for new weapons, armours, engines and entirely new vehicle chassis that you can get as the game progresses. And you can mix and match these to customise your vehicles to suit whatever tactical situation you need. The progression isn't like more modern games with item unlocks and new skin rewards; but you can feel that sense of skill progression as you get better with time. It's easy to learn, but incredibly hard to master.Oh yeah, and its asymmetric, not just red vs blue... Both teams play differently...Also, its got 64 player servers... so massive 32v32 matches can happen... That's almost unheard of in modern games.I unreservedly recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of FPS or RTS games. It deserves more players.It's Absolutely Awesome. 10/10.

												First off, this game is absolutely FREE so you lose nothing from trying it. Probably one of my favourite Source mods in existence and still has a very active playerbase and forum community. Before the game was placed on Steam, I'd play this religiously so my hours would probably be closer to the 200-300hr range. Anyhow, the thing that sets this game apart from others is that in certain gamemodes, it actually has two styles of gaming...Infantry (FPS):The standard mode with classes that have upgrade paths that you customize as you earn experience for contributing to your team. The team can be broken down further into squads that have a squad leader that earns and selects power-ups for well-performing squads. Powers like squad revive can turn the tide of a final ticket push. Under vehicle maps, once a vehicle factory has been built by the commander, all infantry units are capable of building AND CUSTOMIZING the tanks they take into battle, from the weapons that are mounted onto it to the type of amount of armor on the vehicle. The tank battles are the bread and butter of this game as each weapon you're capable of mounting has armors it's good against and ones that it's not. Weight, slots, and cooldown put realistic restrictions on the tanks so you don't have a tank with 5 nukes strapped to it and make the tank battles all the more engaging. Additionally, each class has different upgrades for different vehicles (such as additional cooldown, artillery feedback, etc) that could really give you the advantage in battle.Commander Gameplay (RTS):Theres a steep learning curve, especially against people who have been playing this game for over 5 years. However, once you've got everything else down -- like what weapons are good to research and best way to play each map for each faction -- the commander is the single most powerful player in the game. Each team starts the game voting for a commander. From a top-down view, the commander guides units, places buildings and defensive structures, and determines what technology to research -- much like a typical RTS. However, unlike a standard RTS, your infantry units are actual players who chose how they contribute to the team and provide feedback to the commander on what's working or not.Tl;dr: Awesome game with massive tank and infantry battles and RTS gameplay for advanced players. Also the game is free.

Posted: August 6, 2014
												Don't let this mod fool you. It may look like a Command & Conquer look alike, but there's more to it though.At the beginning of the match, your goal is to either reduce the tickets of the opposing team or destroy their command vehicle.There's 4 classes to choose and each have their own ways of doing things. Not only that, but they also have the ability to learn new skills and perks in combat. There's skills that go with classes and skills that are class specific. Oh and the Engineer counts as a medic too.But that's enough about the soldiers. You must be wondering what makes this an RTS mod because, I'm making it sound like a first person shooter. Well, that's because it's both an FPS and an RTS mod.The RTS part is that whoever gets in the command vehicle, is. . .you guessed it. The commander.The commander is in charge of managing your team's base. You have to upgrade, research and build to help your team. But in order to build something though, a soldier has to be near the position you want to build on. So send in an engineer and tell him what you need building. If your engineer will listen that is.Yes this mod is team work heavy. It's vital if you want to win. Otherwise I can't guarrantee you'll win even a single match if you can't cooperate with your other team mates.So if you want to play a mod that's both an FPS and an RTS, give Empires a try. But I'm sad to say that this mod is almost completely dead. You'll be lucky to find a server with players in it.Also, I recommend getting some training before you try out being a commander. Commander is hard figuring out once you try being one, so get some commander training or else you'll never know what you're doing. As well as get bashed by your team mates for being the worst commander ever.

Posted: August 23, 2014
												An excellent squad based shooter mixed with RTS elements. One player becomes the commander, researching techs for better equipment and vehicles, managing resouces, building pre-set vehicles for faster construction, setting waypoints for ground units and helping to protect the main base. Meanwhile, players on the ground build the projects set by the commander and defend valuable buildings such as barracks and vehicle depots. Combat, for the most part, if fun and challenging with multiple classes and multiple guns for each class. Anti-Armor classes, Base Infantry, and Medics keep pressure on the front line while Engineers contruct turrets and keep bases and resource collectors safe. Sniping is perhaps the most difficult, and yet the most rewarding, since the maps are so large, sniping is a real challenge, but can turn the tide of battles.  As for faults, graphical fidelity is rather low with any given map's group texture being the same texture streched across miles, finally, many maps feature long and dull tracts of land that brings about boring combat. However, despite these few gripes, Empires is an excellent game with many facets that has kept me playing.

												An excellent squad based shooter mixed with RTS elements. One player becomes the commander, researching techs for better equipment and vehicles, managing resouces, building pre-set vehicles for faster construction, setting waypoints for ground units and helping to protect the main base. Meanwhile, players on the ground build the projects set by the commander and defend valuable buildings such as barracks and vehicle depots. Combat, for the most part, if fun and challenging with multiple classes and multiple guns for each class. Anti-Armor classes, Base Infantry, and Medics keep pressure on the front line while Engineers contruct turrets and keep bases and resource collectors safe. Sniping is perhaps the most difficult, and yet the most rewarding, since the maps are so large, sniping is a real challenge, but can turn the tide of battles.  As for faults, graphical fidelity is rather low with any given map's group texture being the same texture streched across miles, finally, many maps feature long and dull tracts of land that brings about boring combat. However, despite these few gripes, Empires is an excellent game with many facets that has kept me playing.

												It's strange that one of the most fascinating and complex multiplayer Source mods of all time has such a small community. I'd highly recommend this game to anyone who's interested in just checking out how games function, really. Even if the multiplayer may be rather dead, that still gives you the chance to experiment with the game's weaponry and such in an offline environment. Note how old this game is, and also just how well-crafted everything is for such an ambitious mod, and I think you'll find yourself far more enthralled than you'll likely have expected yourself to be. The fact that it's still being actively developed only helps to further interest me in this project. ?/10 - seems like it could be one of the best multiplayer Source mods of all time; if it had the community to back it up. It would be great to see a YouTube personality or just about anyone who's famous on the internet organize a community event of some sort, just to see if they can reignite this game's playerbase. One last thing - just in case the devs ever see this, I definitely want to ask about the possibility of a sequel/spiritual successor to this mod. The reason behind this being that a lot of people nowadays just don't care too much about old Source mods, and I definitely feel as if though an updated version of this mod built on a new engine could probably net a much larger community. Anyways, catch you later. This is a rather strange review, I know - I'm barely reviewing this as a mod/game, in fact. It's more of a reflection on my experience with the title. I feel as if though reviewing it as anything else would be dishonest. If you're truly just looking for a multiplayer experience, you should probably stay as far away from this game as possible for now. But if you're looking to mess around with an older title that never gained the recognition it really deserved, I think you'll find this one quite interesting./rant
